Posts.Content: Hi, I feel the same as you, losing my hair is the worst for me too, I had chemotherapy last Saturday and used the cold cap which freezes your hair follicles so the chemo can't reach your hair, have you asked about the cold cap? I will most probably find out next week if it's worked, I'm booked down for it for the next session too, it's bearable but cold and headachy for the first 10-15 mins but after that your brain accepts the cold, i just felt if I don't try it I will never know if I can save my hair.  Your hair can still thin a little/lot but everyone is different.  I have my wig already just incase it doesn't work. Lynne xx
Posts.Title: New to all this

Posts.Content: Hi, I feel the same as you, I haven't lost all my hair through chemo but have lost almost all the hair on the top but still have sides which are about an 1", I didn't know whether to shave it all off so it all comes through the same length......it's so hard knowing what to do as I feel I still have some hair there. It looks like from the replies on here that everyone thinks you should leave it and let it grow.  I have an appointment Friday with a hairdresser who deals with chemotherapy and will see what they say about keeping the fluff or shaving it off...I will keep you informed :) Lynne :)
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: Hi - I know how you feel, I was diagnosed in November, I've had a lumpectomy and had to have further tissue taken as cancerous cells were found in the margin that they took, I have to have six courses of chemotherapy followed by a mastectomy at the end of my treatment. I am coming to terms with it a bit now, at first I felt like you - just numb, that's the only way to describe it, people were reacting to me different, tiptoeing around the subject as they thought I would burst into tears.  I know so much how you're feeling, I had no appetite and just felt drained, I cried but on my own as not to upset anyone around me, It took me a while to actually have a full nights sleep but now I feel a bit calmer towards it all and am sleeping a bit better. Your appointment with a Macmillan nurse with reassure you tomorrow, they are fantastic and know exactly how you're feeling, I've found the posts on here quite good - lots of good advice. Good luck tomorrow, Lynne xx
